trans-unit.source: Use StorSimple Snapshot Manager to manage the backup catalog | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Use StorSimple Snapshot Manager to manage the backup catalog | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Describes how to use the StorSimple Snapshot Manager MMC snap-in to view and manage the backup catalog.
trans-unit.target: Describes how to use the StorSimple Snapshot Manager MMC snap-in to view and manage the backup catalog.

trans-unit.source: Use StorSimple Snapshot Manager to manage the backup catalog
trans-unit.target: Use StorSimple Snapshot Manager to manage the backup catalog

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: The primary function of StorSimple Snapshot Manager is to allow you to create application-consistent backup copies of Azure StorSimple volumes in the form of snapshots.
trans-unit.target: The primary function of StorSimple Snapshot Manager is to allow you to create application-consistent backup copies of Azure StorSimple volumes in the form of snapshots.

trans-unit.source: Snapshots are then listed in an XML file called a backup catalog.
trans-unit.target: Snapshots are then listed in an XML file called a backup catalog.

trans-unit.source: The backup catalog organizes snapshots by volume group, and then by local snapshot or cloud snapshot.
trans-unit.target: The backup catalog organizes snapshots by volume group, and then by local snapshot or cloud snapshot.

trans-unit.source: You can view the backup catalog by expanding the Backup Catalog node in the Scope pane, and then expanding the volume group.
trans-unit.target: You can view the backup catalog by expanding the Backup Catalog node in the Scope pane, and then expanding the volume group.

trans-unit.source: If you click the volume group name, the Results pane shows the number of local snapshots and cloud snapshots available for the volume group.
trans-unit.target: If you click the volume group name, the Results pane shows the number of local snapshots and cloud snapshots available for the volume group.

trans-unit.source: If you click Local Snapshot or Cloud Snapshot, the Results pane shows the following information about each backup snapshot (depending on your View settings):
trans-unit.target: If you click Local Snapshot or Cloud Snapshot, the Results pane shows the following information about each backup snapshot (depending on your View settings):

trans-unit.source: Name – the time the snapshot was taken.
trans-unit.target: Name – the time the snapshot was taken.

trans-unit.source: Type – whether this is a local snapshot or a cloud snapshot.
trans-unit.target: Type – whether this is a local snapshot or a cloud snapshot.

trans-unit.source: Owner – the content owner.
trans-unit.target: Owner – the content owner.

trans-unit.source: Available – whether the snapshot is currently available.
trans-unit.target: Available – whether the snapshot is currently available.

trans-unit.source: True indicates that the snapshot is available and can be restored; False indicates that the snapshot is no longer available.
trans-unit.target: True indicates that the snapshot is available and can be restored; False indicates that the snapshot is no longer available.

trans-unit.source: Imported – whether the backup was imported.
trans-unit.target: Imported – whether the backup was imported.

trans-unit.source: True indicates that the backup was imported from the StorSimple Manager service at the time the device was configured in StorSimple Snapshot Manager; False indicates that it was not imported, but was created by StorSimple Snapshot Manager.
trans-unit.target: True indicates that the backup was imported from the StorSimple Manager service at the time the device was configured in StorSimple Snapshot Manager; False indicates that it was not imported, but was created by StorSimple Snapshot Manager.

trans-unit.source: (You can easily identify an imported volume group because a suffix is added that identifies the device from which the volume group was imported.)
trans-unit.target: (You can easily identify an imported volume group because a suffix is added that identifies the device from which the volume group was imported.)

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Backup catalog</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Backup catalog</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you expand Local Snapshot or Cloud Snapshot, and then click an individual snapshot name, the Results pane shows the following information about the snapshot that you selected:
trans-unit.target: If you expand Local Snapshot or Cloud Snapshot, and then click an individual snapshot name, the Results pane shows the following information about the snapshot that you selected:

trans-unit.source: Name – the volume identified by drive letter.
trans-unit.target: Name – the volume identified by drive letter.

trans-unit.source: Local Name – the local name of the drive (if available).
trans-unit.target: Local Name – the local name of the drive (if available).

trans-unit.source: Device – the name of the device on which the volume resides.
trans-unit.target: Device – the name of the device on which the volume resides.

trans-unit.source: Available – whether the snapshot is currently available.
trans-unit.target: Available – whether the snapshot is currently available.

trans-unit.source: True indicates that the snapshot is available and can be restored; False indicates that the snapshot is no longer available.
trans-unit.target: True indicates that the snapshot is available and can be restored; False indicates that the snapshot is no longer available.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial describes how you can use the Backup Catalog node to complete the following tasks:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial describes how you can use the Backup Catalog node to complete the following tasks:

trans-unit.source: Restore a volume
trans-unit.target: Restore a volume

trans-unit.source: Clone a volume or volume group
trans-unit.target: Clone a volume or volume group

trans-unit.source: Delete a backup
trans-unit.target: Delete a backup

trans-unit.source: Recover a file
trans-unit.target: Recover a file

trans-unit.source: Restore the Storsimple Snapshot Manager database
trans-unit.target: Restore the Storsimple Snapshot Manager database

trans-unit.source: Restore a volume
trans-unit.target: Restore a volume

trans-unit.source: Use the following procedure to restore a volume from backup.
trans-unit.target: Use the following procedure to restore a volume from backup.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: If you have not already done so, create a volume and volume group, and then delete the volume.
trans-unit.target: If you have not already done so, create a volume and volume group, and then delete the volume.

trans-unit.source: By default, StorSimple Snapshot Manager backs up a volume before permitting it to be deleted.
trans-unit.target: By default, StorSimple Snapshot Manager backs up a volume before permitting it to be deleted.

trans-unit.source: This precaution can prevent data loss if the volume is deleted unintentionally or if the data needs to be recovered for any reason.
trans-unit.target: This precaution can prevent data loss if the volume is deleted unintentionally or if the data needs to be recovered for any reason.

trans-unit.source: StorSimple Snapshot Manager displays the following message while it creates the precautionary backup.
trans-unit.target: StorSimple Snapshot Manager displays the following message while it creates the precautionary backup.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Automatic snapshot message</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Automatic snapshot message</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You cannot delete a volume that is part of a volume group. The delete option is unavailable. <html></html>
trans-unit.target: You cannot delete a volume that is part of a volume group. The delete option is unavailable. <html></html>

trans-unit.source: To restore a volume
trans-unit.target: To restore a volume

trans-unit.source: Click the desktop icon to start StorSimple Snapshot Manager.
trans-unit.target: Click the desktop icon to start StorSimple Snapshot Manager.

trans-unit.source: In the Scope pane, expand the Backup Catalog node, expand a volume group, and then click Local Snapshots or Cloud Snapshots.
trans-unit.target: In the Scope pane, expand the Backup Catalog node, expand a volume group, and then click Local Snapshots or Cloud Snapshots.

trans-unit.source: A list of backup snapshots appears in the Results pane.
trans-unit.target: A list of backup snapshots appears in the Results pane.

trans-unit.source: Find the backup that you want to restore, right-click, and then click Restore.
trans-unit.target: Find the backup that you want to restore, right-click, and then click Restore.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Restore backup catalog</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Restore backup catalog</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the confirmation page, review the details, type Confirm, and then click OK.
trans-unit.target: On the confirmation page, review the details, type Confirm, and then click OK.

trans-unit.source: StorSimple Snapshot Manager uses the backup to restore the volume.
trans-unit.target: StorSimple Snapshot Manager uses the backup to restore the volume.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Restore confirmation message</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Restore confirmation message</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You can monitor the restore action as it runs.
trans-unit.target: You can monitor the restore action as it runs.

trans-unit.source: In the Scope pane, expand the Jobs node, and then click Running.
trans-unit.target: In the Scope pane, expand the Jobs node, and then click Running.

trans-unit.source: The job details appear in the Results pane.
trans-unit.target: The job details appear in the Results pane.

trans-unit.source: When the restore job is finished, the job details are transferred to the Last 24 hours list.
trans-unit.target: When the restore job is finished, the job details are transferred to the Last 24 hours list.

trans-unit.source: Clone a volume or volume group
trans-unit.target: Clone a volume or volume group

trans-unit.source: Use the following procedure to create a duplicate (clone) of a volume or volume group.
trans-unit.target: Use the following procedure to create a duplicate (clone) of a volume or volume group.

trans-unit.source: To clone a volume or volume group
trans-unit.target: To clone a volume or volume group

trans-unit.source: Click the desktop icon to start StorSimple Snapshot Manager.
trans-unit.target: Click the desktop icon to start StorSimple Snapshot Manager.

trans-unit.source: In the Scope pane, expand the Backup Catalog node, expand a volume group, and then click Cloud Snapshots.
trans-unit.target: In the Scope pane, expand the Backup Catalog node, expand a volume group, and then click Cloud Snapshots.

trans-unit.source: A list of backups appears in the Results pane.
trans-unit.target: A list of backups appears in the Results pane.

trans-unit.source: Find the volume or volume group that you want to clone, right-click the volume or volume group name, and click Clone.
trans-unit.target: Find the volume or volume group that you want to clone, right-click the volume or volume group name, and click Clone.

trans-unit.source: The Clone Cloud Snapshot dialog box appears.
trans-unit.target: The Clone Cloud Snapshot dialog box appears.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Clone a cloud snapshot</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Clone a cloud snapshot</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Complete the Clone Cloud Snapshot dialog box as follows:
trans-unit.target: Complete the Clone Cloud Snapshot dialog box as follows:

trans-unit.source: In the Name text box, type a name for the cloned volume.
trans-unit.target: In the Name text box, type a name for the cloned volume.

trans-unit.source: This name will appear in the Volumes node.
trans-unit.target: This name will appear in the Volumes node.

trans-unit.source: (Optional) select Drive, and then select a drive letter from the drop-down list.
trans-unit.target: (Optional) select Drive, and then select a drive letter from the drop-down list.

trans-unit.source: (Optional) select Folder (NTFS), and type a folder path or click Browse and select a location for the folder.
trans-unit.target: (Optional) select Folder (NTFS), and type a folder path or click Browse and select a location for the folder.

trans-unit.source: Click Create.
trans-unit.target: Click Create.

trans-unit.source: When the cloning process is finished, you must initialize the cloned volume.
trans-unit.target: When the cloning process is finished, you must initialize the cloned volume.

trans-unit.source: Start Server Manager, and then start Disk Management.
trans-unit.target: Start Server Manager, and then start Disk Management.

trans-unit.source: For detailed instructions, see <link><linkText>Mount volumes</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For detailed instructions, see <link><linkText>Mount volumes</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: After it is initialized, the volume will be listed under the Volumes node in the Scope pane.
trans-unit.target: After it is initialized, the volume will be listed under the Volumes node in the Scope pane.

trans-unit.source: If you do not see the volume listed, refresh the list of volumes (right-click the Volumes node, and then click Refresh).
trans-unit.target: If you do not see the volume listed, refresh the list of volumes (right-click the Volumes node, and then click Refresh).

trans-unit.source: Delete a backup
trans-unit.target: Delete a backup

trans-unit.source: Use the following procedure to delete a snapshot from the backup catalog.
trans-unit.target: Use the following procedure to delete a snapshot from the backup catalog.

trans-unit.source: Deleting a snapshot deletes the backed up data associated with the snapshot. However, the process of cleaning up data from the cloud may take some time.<html></html>
trans-unit.target: Deleting a snapshot deletes the backed up data associated with the snapshot. However, the process of cleaning up data from the cloud may take some time.<html></html>

trans-unit.source: To delete a backup
trans-unit.target: To delete a backup

trans-unit.source: Click the desktop icon to start StorSimple Snapshot Manager.
trans-unit.target: Click the desktop icon to start StorSimple Snapshot Manager.

trans-unit.source: In the Scope pane, expand the Backup Catalog node, expand a volume group, and then click Local Snapshots or Cloud Snapshots.
trans-unit.target: In the Scope pane, expand the Backup Catalog node, expand a volume group, and then click Local Snapshots or Cloud Snapshots.

trans-unit.source: A list of snapshots appears in the Results pane.
trans-unit.target: A list of snapshots appears in the Results pane.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the snapshot you want to delete, and then click Delete.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the snapshot you want to delete, and then click Delete.

trans-unit.source: When the confirmation message appears, click OK.
trans-unit.target: When the confirmation message appears, click OK.

trans-unit.source: Recover a file
trans-unit.target: Recover a file

trans-unit.source: If a file is accidentally deleted from a volume, you can recover the file by retrieving a snapshot that pre-dates the deletion, using the snapshot to create a clone of the volume, and then copying the file from the cloned volume to the original volume.
trans-unit.target: If a file is accidentally deleted from a volume, you can recover the file by retrieving a snapshot that pre-dates the deletion, using the snapshot to create a clone of the volume, and then copying the file from the cloned volume to the original volume.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Before you begin, make sure that you have a current backup of the volume group.
trans-unit.target: Before you begin, make sure that you have a current backup of the volume group.

trans-unit.source: Then, delete a file stored on one of the volumes in that volume group.
trans-unit.target: Then, delete a file stored on one of the volumes in that volume group.

trans-unit.source: Finally, use the following steps to restore the deleted file from your backup.
trans-unit.target: Finally, use the following steps to restore the deleted file from your backup.

trans-unit.source: To recover a deleted file
trans-unit.target: To recover a deleted file

trans-unit.source: Click the StorSimple Snapshot Manager icon on your desktop.
trans-unit.target: Click the StorSimple Snapshot Manager icon on your desktop.

trans-unit.source: The StorSimple Snapshot Manager console window appears.
trans-unit.target: The StorSimple Snapshot Manager console window appears.

trans-unit.source: In the Scope pane, expand the Backup Catalog node, and browse to a snapshot that contains the deleted file.
trans-unit.target: In the Scope pane, expand the Backup Catalog node, and browse to a snapshot that contains the deleted file.

trans-unit.source: Typically, you should select a snapshot that was created just before the deletion.
trans-unit.target: Typically, you should select a snapshot that was created just before the deletion.

trans-unit.source: Find the volume that you want to clone, right-click, and click Clone.
trans-unit.target: Find the volume that you want to clone, right-click, and click Clone.

trans-unit.source: The Clone Cloud Snapshot dialog box appears.
trans-unit.target: The Clone Cloud Snapshot dialog box appears.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Clone a cloud snapshot</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Clone a cloud snapshot</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Complete the Clone Cloud Snapshot dialog box as follows:
trans-unit.target: Complete the Clone Cloud Snapshot dialog box as follows:

trans-unit.source: In the Name text box, type a name for the cloned volume.
trans-unit.target: In the Name text box, type a name for the cloned volume.

trans-unit.source: This name will appear in the Volumes node.
trans-unit.target: This name will appear in the Volumes node.

trans-unit.source: (Optional) Select Drive, and then select a drive letter from the drop-down list.
trans-unit.target: (Optional) Select Drive, and then select a drive letter from the drop-down list.

trans-unit.source: (Optional) Select Folder (NTFS), and type a folder path or click Browse and select a location for the folder.
trans-unit.target: (Optional) Select Folder (NTFS), and type a folder path or click Browse and select a location for the folder.

trans-unit.source: Click Create.
trans-unit.target: Click Create.

trans-unit.source: When the cloning process is finished, you must initialize the cloned volume.
trans-unit.target: When the cloning process is finished, you must initialize the cloned volume.

trans-unit.source: Start Server Manager, and then start Disk Management.
trans-unit.target: Start Server Manager, and then start Disk Management.

trans-unit.source: For detailed instructions, see <link><linkText>Mount volumes</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For detailed instructions, see <link><linkText>Mount volumes</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: After it is initialized, the volume will be listed under the Volumes node in the Scope pane.
trans-unit.target: After it is initialized, the volume will be listed under the Volumes node in the Scope pane.

trans-unit.source: If you do not see the volume listed, refresh the list of volumes (right-click the Volumes node, and then click Refresh).
trans-unit.target: If you do not see the volume listed, refresh the list of volumes (right-click the Volumes node, and then click Refresh).

trans-unit.source: Open the NTFS folder that contains the cloned volume, expand the Volumes node, and then open the cloned volume.
trans-unit.target: Open the NTFS folder that contains the cloned volume, expand the Volumes node, and then open the cloned volume.

trans-unit.source: Find the file that you want to recover, and copy it to the primary volume.
trans-unit.target: Find the file that you want to recover, and copy it to the primary volume.

trans-unit.source: After you restore the file, you can delete the NTFS folder that contains the cloned volume.
trans-unit.target: After you restore the file, you can delete the NTFS folder that contains the cloned volume.

trans-unit.source: Restore the StorSimple Snapshot Manager database
trans-unit.target: Restore the StorSimple Snapshot Manager database

trans-unit.source: You should regularly back up the StorSimple Snapshot Manager database on the host computer.
trans-unit.target: You should regularly back up the StorSimple Snapshot Manager database on the host computer.

trans-unit.source: If a disaster occurs or the host computer fails for any reason, you can then restore it from the backup.
trans-unit.target: If a disaster occurs or the host computer fails for any reason, you can then restore it from the backup.

trans-unit.source: Creating the database backup is a manual process.
trans-unit.target: Creating the database backup is a manual process.

trans-unit.source: To back up and restore the database
trans-unit.target: To back up and restore the database

trans-unit.source: Stop the Microsoft StorSimple Management Service:
trans-unit.target: Stop the Microsoft StorSimple Management Service:

trans-unit.source: Start Server Manager.
trans-unit.target: Start Server Manager.

trans-unit.source: On the Server Manager dashboard, on the Tools menu, select Services.
trans-unit.target: On the Server Manager dashboard, on the Tools menu, select Services.

trans-unit.source: On the Services window, select the Microsoft StorSimple Management Service.
trans-unit.target: On the Services window, select the Microsoft StorSimple Management Service.

trans-unit.source: In the right pane, under Microsoft StorSimple Management Service, click Stop the service.
trans-unit.target: In the right pane, under Microsoft StorSimple Management Service, click Stop the service.

trans-unit.source: On the host computer, browse to C:\ProgramData\Microsoft\StorSimple\BACatalog.
trans-unit.target: On the host computer, browse to C:\ProgramData\Microsoft\StorSimple\BACatalog.

trans-unit.source: ProgramData is a hidden folder.
trans-unit.target: ProgramData is a hidden folder.

trans-unit.source: Find the catalog XML file, copy the file, and store the copy in a safe location or in the cloud.
trans-unit.target: Find the catalog XML file, copy the file, and store the copy in a safe location or in the cloud.

trans-unit.source: If the host fails, you can use this backup file to help recover the backup policies that you created in StorSimple Snapshot Manager.
trans-unit.target: If the host fails, you can use this backup file to help recover the backup policies that you created in StorSimple Snapshot Manager.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure StorSimple backup catalog file</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure StorSimple backup catalog file</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Restart the Microsoft StorSimple Management Service:
trans-unit.target: Restart the Microsoft StorSimple Management Service:

trans-unit.source: On the Server Manager dashboard, on the Tools menu, select Services.
trans-unit.target: On the Server Manager dashboard, on the Tools menu, select Services.

trans-unit.source: On the Services window, select the Microsoft StorSimple Management Service.
trans-unit.target: On the Services window, select the Microsoft StorSimple Management Service.

trans-unit.source: In the right pane, under Microsoft StorSimple Management Service, click Restart the service.
trans-unit.target: In the right pane, under Microsoft StorSimple Management Service, click Restart the service.

trans-unit.source: On the host computer, browse to C:\ProgramData\Microsoft\StorSimple\BACatalog.
trans-unit.target: On the host computer, browse to C:\ProgramData\Microsoft\StorSimple\BACatalog.

trans-unit.source: Delete the catalog XML file, and replace it with the backup version that you created.
trans-unit.target: Delete the catalog XML file, and replace it with the backup version that you created.

trans-unit.source: Click the desktop StorSimple Snapshot Manager icon to start StorSimple Snapshot Manager.
trans-unit.target: Click the desktop StorSimple Snapshot Manager icon to start StorSimple Snapshot Manager.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Learn more about <link><linkText>StorSimple Snapshot Manager tasks and workflows</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Learn more about <link><linkText>StorSimple Snapshot Manager tasks and workflows</linkText><title></title></link>.
